name: Githeri
description: Githeri is a popular Kenyan dish made with a combination of maize (corn) and beans. It's a hearty and flavorful meal that's perfect for any time of day.
ingredients: 1 cup dried beans (such as kidney beans or green beans)
1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste)
instructions: Soak the Beans: Soak the beans overnight in plenty of water. This helps them cook faster and more evenly.
Boil the Maize: Boil the maize in a pot of water until it's tender but not mushy. Drain and set aside.
Sauté the Aromatics: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until fragrant.
Add Spices and Beans: Add the cumin powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder to the pot. Stir to combine. Add the soaked and drained beans to the pot.

Combine and Cook: Add the boiled maize to the pot, along with enough water to cover the ingredients. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the beans and maize are tender and the liquid has thickened. Season with salt to taste.
Serve: Serve hot with a side dish of your choice, such as sukuma wiki (collard greens), or a piece of meat.
